definitions: Alternative Dispute Resolution: A process or set of processes used to resolve disputes outside of traditional litigation.
Adverse Drug Reaction: An unwanted or harmful reaction experienced by a patient as a result of taking a particular drug.

American Depositary Receipt: A certificate issued by a U.S. bank representing shares in a foreign stock, allowing U.S. investors to buy shares in foreign companies without the need to trade on foreign exchanges.
examples: They opted for ADR to settle the contract disagreement.
The patient reported an ADR to the new medication.
Many investors use ADRs to diversify internationally.
